Congratulations again on your new job and completing your college degree! That's fantastic news!

I'm glad you're considering Ubuntu on the Galago Pro or Lemur Pro. Ubuntu is an excellent choice for software engineering, and System76's laptops are designed to work seamlessly with Linux.

**Ubuntu on System76 laptops:**

System76 is an Ubuntu-based company, so you can expect excellent support and integration with Ubuntu. Their laptops come with Ubuntu pre-installed, and their team is heavily involved in the Ubuntu community.

**Tips for getting started with Ubuntu:**

1. **Take the Ubuntu tour:** When you first boot up your new laptop, Ubuntu will offer a guided tour to help you get familiar with the interface and features.
2. **Explore the Software Updater:** Ubuntu's Software Updater will help you keep your system and software up-to-date, ensuring you have the latest security patches and features.
3. **Get comfortable with the terminal:** As a software engineer, you'll likely spend a lot of time in the terminal. Ubuntu's terminal is similar to other Linux terminals, so you can use online resources to learn the basics.
4. **Install development tools:** Use the Ubuntu Software Center or the command line to install development tools like Git, Visual Studio Code, and other IDEs you need for your work.

**Additional resources:**

1. **Ubuntu documentation:** Ubuntu has an extensive documentation website that covers everything from installation to advanced topics.
2. **Ubuntu community:** The Ubuntu community is massive and active, with many online forums, tutorials, and resources available.
3. **System76 support:** System76 offers excellent support, including a comprehensive wiki, community forums, and a dedicated support team.

You're off to a great start, and I'm confident you'll have a fantastic experience with Ubuntu on your new laptop. If you have any questions or need help with anything, feel free to ask!
